subject: p18309149
History: Presumed community-acquired pneumonia with persistent oxygen requirement. Does he have persistent pulmonary edema or has pneumonia improved.
Findings: PA and lateral views of the chest. There has been a decrease in density of the perihilar opacities, which may represent a combination of pulmonary edema and pneumonia. No pleural effusions or pneumothorax. The cardiomediastinal contours are stable.
Impression: Decrease in extent and density of the perihilar opacities since. This likely represents a decrease in pulmonary edema with remaining residual opacities likely representing pneumonia.
